chapter: IMAP-Part 06: Microbiome Bioinformatics Analysis with Qiime2 Pipelines
heading: Welcome to IMAP chapter 06: QIIME2 Bioinformatics Pipeline
text: Embark Chapter 6 IMAP Practical User Guides series delve microbiome profiling QIIME2 pipeline. section builds foundational knowledge established previous chapters, providing standardized methods metadata sequence data retrieval, quality control, comprehensive microbiome profiling using Mothur pipeline. Join us navigate QIIME2 features, leveraging insights gained prior analyses. chapter serves guide smooth transition, empowering skills needed conduct robust microbiome bioinformatics extract meaningful conclusions data.

heading: 1.1 Dive into the official Qiime2 Tutorial
text: -depth walkthrough microbiome analysis using Qiime2 pipeline, explore official tutorial accessible https://docs.qiime2.org/2024.2/tutorials/. comprehensive guide offers step--step approach leverage Qiime2 processing analyzing microbiome data. Covering crucial aspects like data importing, quality control, diversity analysis, result visualization, tutorial enhances proficiency utilizing Qiime2 functionalities. Following resource ensures thorough understanding empowers conduct robust reproducible microbiome analyses.

heading: 1.2 Installing Qiime2 using a bash script
code:
conda update conda

conda install wget

heading: 2 Import or Download Demo Data
text: Demo data one QIIME2[1] tutorials.
code:
mkdir -p resources
mkdir -p resources/reads
mkdir -p resources/references

cd mkdir -p resources/reads

wget \
  -O "sample-metadata.tsv" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2024.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/sample_metadata.tsv"

wget \
  -O "emp-paired-end-sequences/forward.fastq.gz" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2024.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/10p/forward.fastq.gz"

wget \
  -O "emp-paired-end-sequences/reverse.fastq.gz" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2024.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/10p/reverse.fastq.gz"

wget \
  -O "emp-paired-end-sequences/barcodes.fastq.gz" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2024.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/10p/barcodes.fastq.gz"

heading: 5.2 Quality control and feature table with DADA2
text: QIIME2 uses DADA2[2] tool :Detecting poor reads Illumina amplicon sequence data.Denoising.Filtering chimeric sequences.Filtering phiX reads present marker gene.Construction feature table.

heading: 5.3 Using custom SILVA classifier
text: Silva resourcesTaxonomy filesBelow simple outline steps involved constructing QIIME 2 compatible reference SILVA.Begin downloading relevant taxonomy sequence files SILVA.Import files QIIME 2.Prepare fixed-rank taxonomy file.Remove sequences excessive degenerate bases homopolymers.Remove sequences may short /long. option condition length filtering based taxonomy.Dereplicate sequences taxonomy.Build classifier.

heading: 6 QIIME2 Diversity Analysis
text: described

heading: 6.1 Alpha diversity metrics
text: Shannon’s diversity index (quantitative measure community richness)-Observed OTUs (qualitative measure community richness)Faith’s Phylogenetic Diversity (qualitiative measure community richness incorporates phylogenetic relationships features)Evenness (Pielou’s Evenness; measure community evenness)

heading: 6.2 Beta diversity metrics
text: Jaccard distance (qualitative measure community dissimilarity)Bray-Curtis distance (quantitative measure community dissimilarity)unweighted UniFrac distance (qualitative measure community dissimilarity incorporates phylogenetic relationships features)weighted UniFrac distance (quantitative measure community dissimilarity incorporates phylogenetic relationships features)

heading: 6.3 Expected output artifacts
text: Saved FeatureTable[Frequency] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/rarefied_table.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/faith_pd_vector.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/observed_features_vector.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/shannon_vector.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/evenness_vector.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/unweighted_unifrac_distance_matrix.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/weighted_unifrac_distance_matrix.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/jaccard_distance_matrix.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/bray_curtis_distance_matrix.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/unweighted_unifrac_pcoa_results.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/weighted_unifrac_pcoa_results.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/jaccard_pcoa_results.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/bray_curtis_pcoa_results.qza

chapter: 8 Exploring QIIME 2 Output: Feature Table, Taxonomy, and Metadata
heading: 8.1 Initial Data Exploration
text: jumping analysis, let’s get acquainted primary outputs generated QIIME 2:Feature Table: table represents abundance different features (microbial taxa operational taxonomic units) across samples.Feature Table: table represents abundance different features (microbial taxa operational taxonomic units) across samples.Taxonomy Data: Information taxonomic classification feature, helping us understand microbial community composition.Taxonomy Data: Information taxonomic classification feature, helping us understand microbial community composition.Metadata: Additional information associated sample, providing context experimental details.Metadata: Additional information associated sample, providing context experimental details.

chapter: 8 Exploring QIIME 2 Output: Feature Table, Taxonomy, and Metadata
heading: 8.2 Starting the Analysis
text: Load Data: Begin loading Feature Table, Taxonomy, metadata analysis environment.
code:
# Example R code for loading QIIME 2 data
feature_table <- read.table("path/to/feature_table.tsv", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)
taxonomy_data <- read.table("path/to/taxonomy_data.tsv", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)
metadata <- read.table("path/to/metadata.tsv", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)

heading: C Session Information
text: Reproducibility relies ability precisely recreate working environment, session information serves vital reference achieve consistency. record details R environment, package versions, system settings computing environment time analysis.
code:
library(sessioninfo)

# Get session info
info <- capture.output(print(session_info()))

# Define patterns to exclude
exclude_patterns <- c("/Users/.*", "Africa/Dar_es_Salaam") # This line is location-dependent

# Exclude lines containing specific information
info_filtered <- info[!grepl(paste(exclude_patterns, collapse = "|"), info)]

# Save the filtered session info to a text file in the root directory without line numbers
cat(info_filtered, file = "session_info.txt", sep = "\n")
